title: exercise of the powers conferred on me by sections 3 and 14 of the SeaFisheries and Maritime Jurisdiction Act 2006 (No. 8 of 2006) and the Sea
heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the Sea-Fisheries (Shark Fin)
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the Sea-Fisheries (Shark Fin) 

Regulations 2020.
text_norm: 1 regulation may cited sea-fisheries (shark fin) regulation 2020

title: exercise of the powers conferred on me by sections 3 and 14 of the SeaFisheries and Maritime Jurisdiction Act 2006 (No. 8 of 2006) and the Sea
heading: 2. (1) In these Regulations -
text_raw:
2. (1) In these Regulations - 

“Council Regulation” means Council Regulation (EC) No 1185/2003 of 
6 June 2003 as amended by Regulation (EU) No 605/2013 of the 
European Parliament and of the Council of 12 June 2013; 

“operator” has the meaning assigned to it in Article 4(19) of Council 
Regulation (EC) No. 1224/2009 of 20 November 20093; 

(2) A word or expression that is used in the Council Regulation and is also 
used in these Regulations, has, unless the context otherwise requires, the same 
meaning in these Regulations as it has in the Council Regulation.
text_norm: 2 (1) regulation - council regulation mean council regulation (ec) 1185 2003 6 june 2003 amended regulation (eu) 605 2013 european parliament council 12 june 2013 operator meaning assigned article 4(19) council regulation (ec) no 1224 2009 20 november 20093 (2) word expression used council regulation also used regulation unless context otherwise requires meaning regulation council regulation

title: exercise of the powers conferred on me by sections 3 and 14 of the SeaFisheries and Maritime Jurisdiction Act 2006 (No. 8 of 2006) and the Sea
heading: 3. The master of-
text_raw:
3. The master of- 

(a) 

(b) 

an Irish sea-fishing boat wherever it may be, or 

a sea-fishing boat in the exclusive fishing limits of the State, 

shall comply with Article 3(1) and Article 3(1a) of the Council 
Regulation. 

1 OJ L 167, 4.7.2003, p. 1 
2 OJ L 181, 29.6.2013, p.1 
3 OJ L 343, 22.12.2009, p.1 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 15th May, 2020. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4. An operator shall comply with Article 3(2) of the Council Regulation. 

[172] 3 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

13 May, 2020. 

MICHAEL CREED, 

Minister for Agriculture, Food and the Marine. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [172]

title: exercise of the powers conferred on me by sections 3 and 14 of the SeaFisheries and Maritime Jurisdiction Act 2006 (No. 8 of 2006) and the Sea
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations give effect to Council Regulation (EC) No 1185/2003 (as 
amended) on the removal of fins of sharks on board vessels. 

 
 
 
 
 
 [172] 5
